CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Travel to Destination stage positioned above or below the Check-in at Hotel stage?
SRP.A: The Travel to Destination stage is positioned {above} the Check-in at Hotel stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Book Flight?
VE.A: The value of stage Book Flight is {1920}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Check-in at Hotel?
VE.A: The value of stage Check-in at Hotel is {520}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Travel to Destination?
VE.A: The value of stage Travel to Destination is {944}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Book Flight, with a value of {1920}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Check-in at Hotel, with a value of {520}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Travel to Destination to stage Check-in at Hotel?
SC.A: Decreased by {424} Thousand Tourists from stage Travel to Destination to stage Check-in at Hotel.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Book Flight to stage Make Reservation?
SC.A: Decreased by {509} Thousand Tourists from stage Book Flight to stage Make Reservation.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Make Reservation to stage Travel to Destination?
SC.A: Decreased by {467} Thousand Tourists from stage Make Reservation to stage Travel to Destination.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 732? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Book Flight} stage has {1920}, the {Make Reservation} stage has {1411}, the {Travel to Destination} stage has {944}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 732? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 260 and 1665? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Make Reservation} stage has {1411}, the {Travel to Destination} stage has {944}, the {Check-in at Hotel} stage has {520}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Make Reservation to Travel to Destination, or from stage Travel to Destination to Check-in at Hotel?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Make Reservation} to {Travel to Destination} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Travel to Destination to Check-in at Hotel, or from stage Book Flight to Make Reservation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Book Flight} to {Make Reservation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Make Reservation to Travel to Destination, from stage Book Flight to Make Reservation, or from stage Travel to Destination to Check-in at Hotel?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Book Flight} to stage {Make Reservation} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Book Flight} and {Make Reservation} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Travel to Destination} and {Check-in at Hotel} stages.
